title: Honoring Debra Izzo upon the occasion of her designation as recipient of the Board Member of the Year Award
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  Debra  Izzo  upon the occasion of her
designation as recipient of the Board Member of the Year  Award  by  the
Bellmore Chamber of Commerce

WHEREAS,  Individuals  who give of their time and energies and serve the
best interests of their communities are an asset beyond remuneration and
cannot be sufficiently extolled; and
  WHEREAS, Debra Izzo of the Dirty Dawg has given not only of  her  time
and energies but also of her competence, intelligence and leadership and
consequently has been designated for special recognition; and
  WHEREAS,  This  Legislative  Body  is justly proud to honor Debra Izzo
upon the occasion of her designation as recipient of the Board Member of
the Year Award by the Bellmore Chamber of Commerce to be  celebrated  at
its Annual Installation Dinner on January 29, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, When she was a little girl, Debra Izzo wanted to be a Veteri-
narian;  while  attending high school and college, she had many opportu-
nities as to what to do when she graduated;  while  she  enjoyed  animal
science  and  acting in her high school years, when it came time to pick
college courses, she chose accounting  and  computer  programming;  both
were  sufficient  and  she  did  well, however being a person who enjoys
interacting with people, she felt stagnated in  an  office  environment;
and
  WHEREAS,  While having a large variety of jobs in the past, Debra Izzo
felt that nothing fulfilled her enough to pursue a full career until she
started grooming; her career started at the Willow Pet Hotel in 1992 and
then proceeded to Dog Grooming by Rachel where she worked for 11  years;
it  was  now time to move forward and consider opening a business of her
own; and
  WHEREAS, the Dirty Dawg in North Bellmore, New York opened in 2006;  a
family  business  dedicated to its clients, today, it continues to serve
the Bellmore/Merrick communities while gaining a number of  clients  who
travel from as far away as Connecticut; and
  WHEREAS,  Debra  Izzo's  goal  was  to  have  a  small shop that gives
personal and friendly service  with  her  motto  being  "Bring  them  in
soiled, get them back spoiled!"; and
  WHEREAS,  President of the Dirty Dawg, Debra Izzo has been a member of
the Chamber of Commerce of the Bellmores since 2006 and  has  served  on
the Board of Directors since 2008; she serves on various committees such
as Programs and Hospitality, Beautification, Street Fair and Awards; and
  WHEREAS, Debra Izzo has had many opportunities to sponsor a wide vari-
ety  of  clubs,  organizations  and  events, including: The Kennedy High
School Soccer Team, the Students of Bellmore Educational Reference Fold-
ers, the Annual Strawberry Festival, Bellmore Barks and the 24th  Annual
Bellmore  Family  Street  Festival; she also supports the National Child
I.D. Kits and Family Lifeline; and
  WHEREAS, Debra Izzo has been called upon to contribute  her  time  and
talents to countless civic and charitable endeavors and has always given
of herself unstintingly; and
  WHEREAS,  Throughout  the  entire  period  of her community service, a
period of constructive involvement, Debra Izzo  has  stood  constant  in
dignity, good grace and humor; and
  WHEREAS, Rare indeed is the impressive dedication shown by individuals
for  the benefit of others which Debra Izzo has displayed throughout her
life; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  that  those  who
enhance  the well-being and vitality of their community and have shown a
long and sustained commitment to excellence certainly  have  earned  the

recognition and applause of all the citizens of this great Empire State;
now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Debra Izzo upon the occasion of her designation  as  recipient  of
the  Board Member of the Year Award by the Bellmore Chamber of Commerce;
and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Debra Izzo.
